Fields.DialogueText: Hiyaaah! (Ooh, this is getting dizzy... )
Takao, are you– aaah!
Sorry about that, Kanchou! I didn't mean to nearly decapitate you. Please forgive my transgression.
It's all right. But what were you doing, anyway? Usually you're really accurate with your sword, but it just seemed like you were spinning crazily.
I have been working on a new sword technique: komajutsu.
The "way of the top"?
I've always admired the grace of a spinning top, you know? So I thought perhaps it could be translated into a formidable fighting method.
Certainly formidable. It almost cut me straight in half.
Well... it's still a work in progress.

Fields.MenuText: Just try to practice in an open space where you won't hit anyone.
The problem I see is that it takes away your fabled accuracy.
It's certainly a unique tactic.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. I suppose this is why samurai prefer to retreat to the mountains to practice their art.
I know! And that's my one issue with the whole idea. But on the other hand, if I can master this, I know that I can strike with perfect precision no matter the situation.
I know, and that is exactly why I wish to make it into a sword art. If I can show how the ways of the sword can still grow in new directions, the practice will live on.
Well, you're certainly a determined warrior, so I'm sure you will get it in time.
Thank you. I should get back to practicing it. Sorry, but you might want to back up a bit.
Actually, I think you should hold off on it for a little bit. Can't have you being dizzy when we have Morganas to destroy!
@BATTLE
Let's see... The ingredients took a bit of a beating to get here, but I can still make do.
Hello, Takao. What are you working on here?
Hello there, Kanchou. I was trying to make some classic obanzai, but I am having a little bit of difficulty with the ingredients.
What seems to be the problem? You're usually pretty capable of finding food just about anywhere. Especially now that we have that garden blooming.
The issue is that I need to obtain all the supplies from Japan; specifically my home city.
You do? Why, are they things that don't grow anywhere else?
Not exactly. It's a tradition for obanzai to consist of only things specifically from the city.
Did you manage to get some?
Yes, but it's not exactly what I was hoping for. On the one hand, the shipping took its toll on the quality. And on the other hand... it just looks too good.
Isn't that usually a good thing?
Yes, but obanzai is based on the value of recycling, with throwaways often being the key ingredients. Sadly, those are the ones least capable of making the journey here.

Fields.MenuText: If it's the principle behind the food that matters the most, shouldn't that take priority?
Technically, you represent your home mountain, and your city. So technically, any food obtained from here would qualify.
Food from garbage sounds... unusual, but I would like to try it, if at all possible.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. It's just like a novice monk arguing about the scales on a dragon rather than caring about the true message. I'll make obanzai that still upholds the values of my home.
Good point. In that case, the ingredients from the garden will work just fine. After all, you navy types are so wasteful with the skins. They might as well be put to good use.
Don't worry. I'll do my best to find a way for you to sample it.
Thank you for talking this over with me. I think I can move forward now.
You're welcome. I look forward to learning what obanzai tastes like.
I'll put my full effort into it. And maybe after the war is over we could try some of the traditional variety back home!
That would be nice. I'd like to see how they make it in Tokyo.
Tokyo? No, obanzai is from Kyoto.
Wait, but you said...
Sorry, but we'll have to talk later. Right now, some Morganas need to be sent to the trash heap.
@BATTLE
Takao, I wanted to ask you about before. You said that obanzai comes from Kyoto.
Yes, it is one of our great prides there.
But you also said that it was from your hometown. I thought you were from Mount Takao -- part of Tokyo.
Yes, that is true.
But then, why...?
Because I am named after Mount Takao.
...Yes? And that was what I just said. Then why Kyoto?
Where else for the grand temple on Mount Takao?
In Tokyo, maybe?
No, Takao's temple is in Kyoto.
Wait... is Mount Takao somehow encompassing both Tokyo and Kyoto? I thought those two cities were a fair distance from each other.
No, but there are two Mount Takaos, and I was named after the Kyoto one.
Huh...

Fields.MenuText: You could have been a more direct with the explanation, you know.
If you were named after that Takao, then why do you also claim heritage to the one by Tokyo?
With heritage in two of Japan's fabled capitals, I can see where your imperial blood as a warrior comes from.

Fields.DialogueText: I could have, but your perplexed reactions were quite amusing. You have a long way to go as a fighter, pupil.
Well, a lot of people are more aware of Tokyo's mountain these days, so they thought I was named after that one. So when I awoke, I found that I had memories of both sites.
Exactly. Both my homes are esteemed for their long duty to the emperors, and I will do my best to continue their legacy into the present.
Well, Takao of Tokyo or Takao of Kyoto, you're still the Takao I know.
Thank you, Kanchou... hey, what was that last part?
Oh, we'll have to talk later, Takao. I see more Morganas on the horizon.
@BATTLE
For such a stoic and fiery samurai, you certainly have your own sense of humor.
The mysteries behind the Belles are quite deep indeed.
Almost there... uh-oh. Help!
Kanchou, what are you...?
Just help me, please!
Hang on, I've got you!
Thanks. That was a close one.
Kanchou, why were you trying to scale the ship like that? You could have gotten hurt!
Well, you got up to the roof fine, so why not me?
I'm a Belle, so I don't have to worry about that. But you need to be more careful.

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted to get stronger like you.
I wanted to see if you were doing all right up there.
I'm sorry. It just seemed like a way to test my limits.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Baka. You are already strong in your own way. Do not try to force yourself to extremes, but rather make use of your special gifts to excel as a hero.
Ah, that makes sense. It is rather difficult to get up here. I used that to get privacy, but I didn't think about the other implications.
You need to be patient when you test yourself. A challenge is good, but a severe injury can leave a lasting impact on yourself.
Well, at least I got up here in the end.
I'll try to find a way to make access easier for you. Just try not to put yourself at too much risk, please?
You're one to talk about taking risks.
There's a difference between taking risks in war and in times of peace. Allow me to show you the difference now.
But first, could you please help me back down again?
@BATTLE
Heave... ho!
Takao, what's with that huge filter you're dragging?
Oh, I'm trying to extract some sea salt to supplement our salt supply.
That sounds interesting, but what is all the salt for?
I intend to make tsukemono.
What is that?
It is a process for pickling vegetables for preservation.
Oh, I see. That would be useful in keeping our supplies good for the long haul.
My thoughts exactly. It is critical that every bit of food gets put to good use. An army runs on its stomach, after all.
In any case, it's good that you're looking out for the supplies like that.
Well, I admit that there is a secondary motivation for me.
What's that?
You see, it's an important course in the larger form of the tea ceremony. I am sorry that some of the supplies are being used for my selfish ends.

Fields.MenuText: Hey, it's fine for you to use a few things for your personal pursuits. We all have things we like to do.
In that case, I look forward to trying that part of the ceremony with you.
A lot of us like participating in the tea ceremony. So just think of it as an allocation for war morale if you feel guilty.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. That means a lot to me.
Well, I promise to do my best with it.
Good point. Warriors like us, whether on land or sea, need to get into the right mindset for battle.
So anyway, want me to help?
Of course! I should have enough salt right now, so we should pick some of the vegetables from the garden.
Actually, we might need to postpone that. We've really become old salts at the art of stumbling into Morgana routes, haven't we?
@BATTLE
Can't wait to see what it's like.
Takao, why are you stringing these huge cables up the deck and to the masts?
This is my solution to the problem in accessing the roof; aside from me, that is.
Oh, so you're still working on that. I'm not sure if this will work, though. It would still be trying to climb up the line.
No, this is just the first stage of the project. Next, I'll have to load on some modified chairs and rail cars.
Wait, do you mean you intend to construct a full cable-car line onboard?
It is a tried and true way of safe ascendance up mountains. The railway's had it running up the mountain for over a decade now.

Fields.MenuText: This ship isn't as big as a mountain, though.
All right, assuming you can get everything to run safely.
You're going through all this effort just so I can get up on the roof with you?

Fields.DialogueText: I see. So I'll need to modify myself accordingly first.
Don't worry. Safety is the watchword.
Of course! You're my friend. Why wouldn't I challenge mountains for that?
Well, just watch it with all of that equipment -- I don't want things to get tangled when we come up against the Morgana again.
Don't worry, everything is secured; and just in the nick of time, once more.
@BATTLE
That's not what I meant.
Thank you.
Kagome, kagome, little bird in...
Pew! Takao, what is that stench! The whole deck reeks of the smell now!
Smell? Oh, you mean the light fragrance hanging about me?
Fragrance?! Please tell me that this isn't some traditional perfume you've taken to using.
No, the scent comes from the tsukemono I was preparing.
Why did you think it was a good idea to let that smell loose here?
You gave me permission.
That was before I knew what it did to my nose! Get rid of it!
And put all this food to waste? Never.

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't the "fragrance" seem a bit too bold to you?
It's going to be a morale issue if we have to store this for the long term.
The food had better taste good.

Fields.DialogueText: All right, so it is kind of strong. But endurance builds character.
Don't worry. Once we get it properly wrapped up, the food should stay good, with no rogue scents.
It will, I promise.
Well, at least that wind coming in cleared up the smell up on the deck.
Wind? Isn't it supposed to be a calm day today?
*ALARM*
Not when the Morganas decide to call. Let's get to work -- but wrap up the food first!
@BATTLE
It also builds up agony in your nostrils.
Thank goodness.
All right, I'll trust you on that.
Hey, Takao, who's that ship there in the picture? Is she one of your cousins?
...I suppose you could say that. Her name is Mikasa.
Looks a little old, but still powerful. Definitely a warrior like you.
Yes, she is. One of our greatest ships.
Hey, maybe we'll have the chance to fight alongside her one of these days.
...No, I very much doubt that will be happening.
Why? There's always the chance we might meet up for one reason or another. Where is she now, on special assignment or something?
A museum in Yokosuka.
What? Wait, you mean...?
Yes, she was retired in 1922. Therefore, she has not been given the power of a woken kami. That is limited to those who still serve.
But to just be decommissioned like that...
Such is the fate of weapons. A blade is a formidable opponent, but it only exists for battle. And the continual conflict steadily eats away at its power, until it finally breaks and is discarded.
You... don't see that as your future, do you?
Perhaps, if I survive long enough. My purpose is to be the sword of my homeland, and I will fulfill that promise to the end. With our sacrifices, we seed the future for the world.

Fields.MenuText: You said you're a kami, right? So you're more than just a simple weapon. You have your own hopes and dreams; hold onto them.
But you said that Mikasa is in a museum now; and you keep a picture of her. That shows that people still care about her. So stay strong -- we're all here for you.
Weapons are meant to be disposable. But soldiers and warriors are living things. After all, a weapon wouldn't come up with some many harebrained ideas.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. I have to have faith in myself and the future. Miracles can happen, and I will continue to pray for one for my dear mentor.
Thank you. Your camaraderie is my greatest strength in this war.
You're right. Hey, my ideas are perfectly sound!
Who knows? Maybe one day the older ships will also wake up, as long as we're here to welcome them into the world.
A lot will have changed by then. But then again, we still find ways to live and laugh in this new world of dreams and nightmares.
Anyway, I see a Morgana fleet over there. We'd better get ready.
Watch me, Mikasa. I'll make you proud today!
@BATTLE
Well, they're certainly fun to explore, that's for sure!
Darn, these Morganas aren't making our job easy.
That is to be expected. However many their faults, I can at least respect their determination as fighters.
Kind of difficult to admire that when it's giving them more strength to kill us.
There is no hate in battle, only joy at the glory.
Forgive me, but I have trouble feeling anything but fear right now.
Whoever said that fear was absent from the battlefield?
Huh?
Even now I fear what may happen if I fall and break my promise to the fleet and my home. But I control that terror inside me, and I focus on my duty and honor.
I see.
It takes time to master it, but you must remain serene even as death hangs over you. Only then will you have the strength to surpass mountains.
Thanks, that helps a lot.
I am simply helping my apprentice move forward. Now, then, it looks like we are at a turning point in the tide. What do you wish of me now?

Fields.MenuText: Target the flagship. Don't waste your time on the small fry.
Get rid of the escorts so we can focus on the real target.
Give us some covering fire so we can close in.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry; a few shots, and that colossus will sink all the way to the bottom.
Got it. They won't stand in our way for much longer.
All my guns are locked and ready for a wave of destruction. Get ready to move when the time is right.
We've got them now! Just a little more!
That's right! Show your true strength as a soldier! For the Chrysanthemum Throne!
@BATTLE
Hello, Kanchou.
Hi, Tak– what happened to you? Your skin is all red? Did you get sun-burnt or something?
Don't be ridiculous. I always make sure to moderate my exposure. This is clay.
Huh. I see. Still doesn't explain why it was all over your arms.
Well, I was trying to do a little more remodeling to make this place seem more like home.
Another natural renovation, then? I hope you didn't make too much of a mess this time.
Of course not. It wasn't that bad. I mean, the clay should harden in just a few hours, and then you won't have to worry about brushing up against it.
What!? Takao... Did you remember to put up warnings, so people don't stumble into it like wet paint?
No, it must have slipped my mind. But it looks really beautiful -- and it will be even better at sunset!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure if the clay will hold out here, not with all the humidity.
Well, what's done is done. This place is already part nature park already, so why not?
You do have to admit that it is a little messy.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but I really want the red cliffs to last, if only for just a little bit.
Thank you. This place is really seeming like home now.
A little grime helps to build soldiers, but I see your point. I'll try to tidy up just a bit.
Anyway, this is what the red cliffs look like. What do you think?
Well, I don't exactly like the aftereffects on everything else nearby, but you're right. It is pretty to gaze down from.
I know. It's one of the features at Kyoto's mountain. In fact, there's a tradition of throwing clay plates over to see if they can reach the river below.
There is? Perhaps we can try it.
Well, I don't have any clay works at hand, but we do have our ammo. That is probably a better use given what's coming our way.
@BATTLE
Are you ready for our training session?
I am, but those Morganas don't seem to agree!
@BATTLE
Sigh... Another day, another fight.
Why so glum? A soldier should be humble, but you should also rejoice in our victory.
It's just that we've had a lot of close shaves the last few times...
And we have come out all the stronger from them.
Yes, but what about the rest of the world? Every day, more and more falls to the Morganas. Sometimes I wonder if one day we'll be the only ones left.
Let me tell you about the Chrysanthemum Throne, the imperial line of Japan. It dates back to the fabled Emperor Jimmu, a descendant of both the sun and storm deities.
Huh. How long ago was that?
Just... oh, 2600 years, give or take.
What? But that was so long ago!
And yet his proud lineage of heirs still gives light to our islands, giving us hope in the darkness.
You really think so?
I know so. And we too must have faith that, even if everything falls, our history will live on unbroken.

Fields.MenuText: Are you really sure that the line survived unscathed for so long?
I guess it comes down to all of us doing our part.
You're right. As long as we don't give up here, we give everyone else the strength to survive for one day more.

Fields.DialogueText: To be honest, no. There have been a couple of uncertain times way back. But does it really matter?
Yes. We cannot abandon our responsibilities. I will fight to my last breath to see everyone safe.
You see? Our actions today help set the example for others to follow. No matter what happens, our quest will endure for eons, so long as we prove our valor.
Thanks. That helps my spirit a lot.
You're welcome. Now, then, shall we have a tea ceremony to honor our efforts?
It would be my pleasure.
What do you mean?
The dream, the vision of a united line and future endures, and that in itself is inspiring.
Kanchou, do you happen to know where we will be landing next?
I think I can get you a list of our itinerary. Why, hoping to get some vacation time?
You should know that a warrior never rests. Mostly, I wanted to know what sort of wildlife they have there. Then again, I'm probably better off just ordering some.
I see. So, did you– wait. Order what, exactly?
Just a few wild boars?
You want to turn the ship into a farm as well, with livestock?!
No, no. Boars, not their naïve domestic counterparts. I want them to run wild in a couple select areas of the ship to give it more excitement.
Yeah, excitement's the word. Takao, have you been drinking?
You know I never drink.
I know. I was just giving you an easy excuse. Have you really thought this through?
Well, not entirely. After all, I'm still figuring out how to get them on board.

Fields.MenuText: Takao, boars are dangerous. And while I know you like a little excitement, this is taking things too far.
If the boars run wild, they'll wreck the ship, including your gardens.
I am drawing a line here, Takao. We are not importing boars, and that is an order.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I just got carried away with making this like a wild mountain. But I have the responsibility to look after everyone.
Good point. This could backfire.
I understand and obey.
I'm sorry, Kanchou. You're right. It really wasn't that good of an idea.
Look, if you promise to manage things well, I can let you raise a few domestic pigs on board.
That would help with the supplies a bit. Thank you.
You're welcome. Mostly, I just don't want to have to deal with ravenous beasts.
Quite right. The Morganas more than fulfill that niche for us.
@BATTLE
You think?
So, Kanchou, up for another hike?
Sure. How far are we going this time?
Just 3 kilometers or so. Much farther and we'd start looping around again.
Whew, that's still a ways.
Less standing, and more walking, student. If you want to keep talking with me, you have to keep up.
Sorry! It's just kind of tiring after a while.
Nevertheless, it is good exercise, while also giving you the time to think.
I guess you're right. Still, do you actually work out by doing this? I mean, you're basically walking on yourself.
Well, I like to think that I am still growing stronger as a warrior. Once you reach an unchanging pinnacle, there's nowhere to go except backward.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I personally think it's less about getting stronger, and more about simply enriching your life with different things.
Yeah. We can't slow down with the Morganas at our heels.
You're definitely growing stronger every day.

Fields.DialogueText: A good philosophy. I emphasize strength, but it is the spiritual aspect that forms the cornerstone.
Yes. We're in a fight for survival, and we cannot give the enemy a single inch for quarter.
You are as well. We all are, and soon we will have the Morganas in retreat.
Thanks for putting up with my exercises.
No problem. To be honest, for all my griping I've enjoyed the training.
That's good to know. I'm really proud of you.
I'm really proud too, for the opportunity to train under you.
Now it's time for another test of your combat prowess. I await your command.
@BATTLE
All right, Kanchou, get ready for some classic Kyoto cuisine.
All right, I'm all set. But... is it really made from trash?
Edible trash. It's an important distinction.
Good to know.
And you won't have to worry about cross-contamination. I took most of the ingredients from your own trash bin.
Oh... thank you, I guess?
So come on, dig in!
... What if it makes me seasick?
You won't. You're stronger than that. And if you do, I'll help you work it out of your system with a special training ordeal.
Glad to know you care.
Now, enough excuses. Eat!
All right, here I go.
Some Minutes Later
So... how was it?

Fields.MenuText: I think I felt something move... just kidding!
It tasted really good.
It tasted good; as long as I still feel good in a few hours, it has my full recommendation.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I must have missed that one centipede that was in the tomatoes.
Thank you. I'm glad you like it.
You worry too much. You just have to take your chances, just like a shark hunting a puffer fish.
In any case, thank you for sharing with me.
You're welcome. It's not quite the same as Kyoto-grown obanzai, but I think it still has its own appeal, right?
Exactly. You bring your own gifts to the mix. Just like they come in handy against the Morganas.
Speaking of which, here they come.
Now I really hope my stomach stays calm. I can't afford to lose my composure in battle!
@BATTLE
Urk!
Heh. Got you.
Aren't puffer fish toxic?
All right, bad comparison. But still, I made sure everything was sanitary.
Takao, I know you said there's a tradition about throwing clay plates, but this is over the top! And it looks like you're launching them upward, not downward.
Oh, that's so I can get some target practice in.
I see. But do you really need to throw them that high?
I wanted to get some target practice in against aerial targets.
Why? The Morganas haven't figured out how to fly, have they?
No, but I still want to be able to take on enemies from the sky as well. It's always been a sort of ambition for me.
I never imagined that.
Well, I'm not sure if it will work out. But I am not giving up.

Fields.MenuText: Is it at all connected with your interest in the tengu?
It might come in handy if the war shifts to non-Morgana opponents.
Well, it's something to push yourself to the limits for, so go for it!

Fields.DialogueText: It is. I've always admired the freedom of birds, and I want to be able to prove that I can be their equal.
Please don't say that!
Thanks. I'll show them the spirit of a mountain in the sea.
Well, good luck with your dream!
Thank you. Now, though, I need to focus on sea-bound targets.
I see what you mean. Still, land or sky, nothing escapes your wrath.
Yes. I will make sure that none of them escape unscathed!
@BATTLE
Takao...?
Sorry, it's just... if that happens, who knows who I'll be facing, or who you will face?
Mountain in the sea touching the sky... sounds like a poem, almost.
Takao!
Can it wait? I am tending to an ill sailor.
Sure, I'll wait. But I want to talk with you.
All right, I'm done. What is it?
I want to know what is up with these spear platforms outside the hall.
I was trying to perform a Gion Matsuri in response to the ill soldiers on board.
What's that?
It's a festival that originated in Kyoto as a prayer for deliverance from a plague.
And these things are part of the ceremony?
Yes. They are called hooks. And I plan to have them stationed here until everyone is well again.

Fields.MenuText: Do they have to be spears, though?
But you're a skilled medic. Are these really going to help you?
What do you intend to do with them?

Fields.DialogueText: No, they've been replaced with simple pillars of late, but I decided to do it in the traditional fashion.
I certainly am a trained doctor, and I intend to put my full effort into healing them. But one must not neglect the spiritual aspects.
They can serve as a symbol of hope for people. The soldiers will have be inspired to have faith that they will be saved, and those prayers will drive us to stay alive.
Well, that helps explain things. At first, I thought that you planned to use them as some sort of backup arsenal.
No, I have plenty of spears elsewhere for martial uses. Still, they are a formidable warning for ill spirits to stay away, don't you think?
Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to deter the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Trying to plant more trees on board? It seems more like a forest every day.
That's the plan. I feel pretty good about these latest ones.
What kind of tree is it?
An oak tree; specifically a zelkova. I specifically ordered that variety.
Why a zelkova in particular?
Its wood is especially durable yet light, perfect for warships.
Takao, I know that we're at sea, but we don't exactly use wooden ships anymore.
I know, but my birthplace of Yokosuka has always looked to the sea. Such trees are an important symbol.

Fields.MenuText: Well, we could use some wood for lifeboats.
Do you think they will grow all right within the boundaries of the ship?
I might want to climb one once it grows bigger.

Fields.DialogueText: Good idea. But we'll need to wait until there is a stable population.
Don't worry. Despite its size, the zelkova can easily thrive in confined spaces.
Me too. Just be careful not to slip. I won't always be there to catch you.
Well, I have to say that the new stock looks pretty nice.
Thanks. I really like the natural feel to the ship.
I was kind of hesitant about the whole idea at first, but it does give the troops better morale these days.
But of course. As you immerse yourself in nature, you can find a sense of peace and serenity.
Just as long as the Morganas don't spoil it.
Now, Kanchou, what did I tell you? Once you reach true harmony, even the fiercest of foes cannot disrupt you.
@BATTLE
Really, now. This place has its own ecosystem budding.
Just don't blockade the halls with them.
Takao, did you bring in even more rocks? I have to practically pull myself over them to get -- wah!
*SPLASH*
Careful, Kanchou! You'll disturb the fish!
Oof... What's with all of the water?
I decided to start a little koi garden.
Koi? Is that some kind of seaweed?
No, no. It's a carp, a kind of fish.
I see them now. They look kind of like goldfish, actually.
Do not be fooled. Though tamed by man, carp still have a strong spirit, enough to even become dragons.
Interesting. So yet another environment in our little nature park.
Yes, isn't it great?

Fields.MenuText: Just keep a close eye on those fish. I've heard that they can wreak havoc in freshwater areas if they get loose.
What's with that dragon's head you have carved on that one fountain?
Well, more emergency food supplies for us, I suppose.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand, and I will take full responsibility for them.
An old tradition in China. If a carp has enough strength and resilience to completely ascend a waterfall, it will become a dragon.
For you, perhaps. I will stick to my vegetarian course.
They do look pretty nice in the water. Still, it just makes me kind of nervous, storing large amounts of water on the ship. It's kind of inviting the ship to sink.
It won't sink as long as we stay strong.
I hope so. Here come some more Morganas to test us in that regard.
@BATTLE
I get what you mean. It's kind of like our own struggle. One day we'll reach the sky as well.
What's going on out... Takao, get to your station! You might get a chance to practice your aerial combat sooner than you thought!
Relax, Kanchou. They're just kites.
Ah, I see. I was caught off guard by them. Having fun with them?
Yep! There's a lot of wind today, so it's the perfect weather for them.
Mind if I try flying one of them?
Sure! The more the merrier. Take your pick.
Let's see... which one should I choose?

Fields.MenuText: The fish one.
The one with the swordsman on it.
The bamboo one.

Fields.DialogueText: The carp? Well, then, do your best to climb into the sky with it, and become a dragon.
Excellent choice. The brave warrior is Minamoto, who was trained by the tengu themselves.
Going for the traditional approach? Good idea.
Now let's see who can fly the kite the best!
You're on!
We might need to call off the contest, Takao. The winds are getting a little too fierce.
I can see why– over there!
@BATTLE
Oh? That's an auspicious design indeed.
Hey there, Takao. What are you tying around the tree there?
A shimenawa, a sacred rope.
Doing some kind of ritual with it?
Of a sort. I am marking the trees as sacred.
They are? I didn't realize that when you planted them.
No, they weren't. But now that they're marked, they can be identified as such.

Fields.MenuText: What will the trees do?
Is this theologically sound?
You take your duties quite seriously, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: On their own, not much. But they are now marked as symbols of the kami, and that is the first step toward miracles.
It's a little edgy, but I am technically a kami, so by right I may choose receptacles for my power.
I do. I am not only a soldier but also a spiritual herald for my nation. I will fulfill my obligations thus.
I wonder sometimes, Takao, what do you think of yourself? What do you see yourself as? A kami? A youkai?
Only time will give those answers, if ever. So I am content to know that I exist, that I serve my country, and that I am blessed with powers. That is enough to satisfy me.
You're really something, Takao.
I do my best. As we all must. But enough -- I'm sensing Morganas. Take general quarters! May the gods and karma of the world guide us to victory!
@BATTLE
We certainly need plenty of those these days.
Well, we know so little about the Belles, so I can hardly argue with that.
The rain is really coming down now.
Well, at least we're safe and warm inside the cabin.
Still, it peeves me that the time I allotted for our training is going to waste.
You have to learn to relax a little, Takao. Sometimes it's good to take a break and not think about standing under a waterfall or something else crazy.
Waterfall... Hey, that gives me an idea.
Oh, no...
We may not have a waterfall here, but the rain offers a decent substitute for suigyo.
Let me get this straight: you want to stand out in the rain for hours?
Well, not by myself, no. This will be good training for you.
For me? No, thanks. Leave me out of this one.
Come on, it will build up your endurance.

Fields.MenuText: I just don't want to get hypothermia.
I'd rather work on planning out our campaign inside here.
Fine, but just for a little bit.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Kanchou. I'll be there to make sure you don't get sick.
I suppose that is a valid point. Maybe I can work on my calligraphy.
Great! Let's get started.
Actually, I think it's a moot point.
Oh, I see. The storm is going away. Too bad.
Even so, that thunder still sounds close.
That's not thunder. It's something much worse.
@BATTLE
Very good, Captain. Now it's time for the next step in the training.
What sort of exercise do you want me to do this time?
Nothing specific. Rather, I need to move your awareness to the next level.
What do you mean?
You first needed to know how to hold and swing a sword to be able to fight to begin with. But now you must learn to naturally attack without even thinking about it.
How are you going to do that?
Simple immersion.
So, a battle then? Let's get on with it!
Not so fast. I am not going to attack you now. But one moment, when your guard is down, I will strike. It is up to you to counter my blows.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds really tricky.
Any time?
Perhaps I should try to surprise-attack you as well.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't fret. I have faith in your capabilities. You just need a little push.
Any time, whether day or night.
You are certainly an obstinate student. But I welcome the challenge.
Well, then, I'll do my best to be ready.
We will see.
In any case, did you...
*ALARM*
Great, just great. Takao, get to your post and– hey, is now the best time for this?
Well done Kanchou! On your first try, no less! And to answer you, it is not. Which is exactly why I thought to test you now.
Just keep your focus on the enemy for now, please. We have enough things to worry about.
@BATTLE
What's with the blank faces you have on those posters up there? Are they meant to be that youkai you were telling me about earlier?
You mean the nopperabo? No, I was thinking of playing fukuwarai.
What sort of game is that?
You blindfold yourself and then try to pin the different facial features onto the face.
I see. It sounds kind of tricky, though.
The challenge is the best part of it. And it is an essential part of your training, as it helps you identify your surroundings without relying on your sight.
And it's also a way for you to have fun, right?
That too.
All right, put the blindfold on me. We can give it a go.
All right, let us see who is the master at this.
Well, I'm finished.
You certainly are. Look at how far off you were.

Fields.MenuText: You made your own mistakes with your face, Takao.
Please don't laugh at me.
It does look rather funny, doesn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, there's always room to improve. I'll just have to do better the next time.
Sorry. I just thought that this would be a fun game.
I know, right?
Well, that was a fun game.
Indeed. Nevertheless, I hope that you have learned some things from it.
Yes, I am more aware than ever. For instance, I can feel from the noises behind me that another Morgana is approaching.
See? Your training is already paying off.
@BATTLE
Yeah, I'm sorry I got worked up over it.
Is that ship friend or foe?
Foe, definitely foe. Let's get rid of it.
@BATTLE
Well, that's one more Morgana down for the count, at least for now.
Don't worry so much. Victory was ours, and we should be thankful.
You're right.
Still, I could have done better in that last round. I need more guns at my disposal.
Are you sure? You already have a bunch of them.
Still not enough for my taste. And actually, if I could find more use for them in the battles we have, I could use more swords as well.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you want a sword that is also a gun?
Just try to avoid overloading yourself. You tend to get clumsier the more you pack onto yourself.
You really don't rest until you've eradicated the enemy.

Fields.DialogueText: Like a musket, but more advanced? That would be interesting, but it sounds kind of far-fetched, like one of Kaguya's treasures from the moon.
That only means I have to work so that I can handle the extra burden.
Of course. I don't want to let everyone down. Even so, I like being able to target individual foes; that's why multitasking with tons of weapons is great.
Fine, I can order some more. But it's coming out of your budget, got it?
I understand. So, do you want to do another tea ceremony?
From guns to tea. You are a complicated person, Takao.
Practicing your calligraphy again? You're really good at this.
Thank you. I'm trying to develop new styles to explore.
Well, I like that you are finding ways to keep yourself occupied outside of just training and battle.
Actually, I see this as a form of training in itself. It helps me construct new approaches that I could apply...
Takao, do you have to connect everything to fighting?
It's what I was made for. I might as well embrace that role and make the best of it.
Still, you enjoy other things. I see how you like to have fun, too.
In truth, I'm trying to find out who I am. There is so much I have yet to know about my existence.
Then why are you so set on warfare?
Because I feel a sense of energy as I face danger. As I become the greatest warrior, perhaps I will find the answers.

Fields.MenuText: Just make sure that you don't miss something along the way.
I can't wait to see what you discover!
I'm sure that you will get there one day!

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not. Every encounter along the road has its own fated purpose.
Yes. Let's see what the future has in store for all of us.
Thank you. And I know you will as well.
And, one day, we will break past the mists around us and find the truth of the world.
For now, let's just do our best.
